intro: Erigeron elegans, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open areas such as prairies and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron elegans is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
